name.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Tabiverse: Space & Planets in New Tab

short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Fill your new tab with cool planets, stars, and asteroids from space, giving you awesome interactive space themed 3D HD wallpapers!

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Features:
üåçGet a random planet, star, gas giant, or asteroid in every new tab
üåçA hud that shows the current date, time, and planet info
üåçShare your planet coordinates with your friends so that they can explore the same planets.
üåçExplore travel history and save favorite planets
üåçEnter coordinates manually to explore the procedural universe
üåçShuffle to go to a planet at random coordinates
üåçInfinite random 3D interactive space themed wallpapers!

Tabiverse is a procedurally generated universe in your browser new tab. Every time you open a new tab, you are teleported to a procedural planet in space with random terrains, oceans, atmosphere, and biomes. The random planets, stars, gas giants, and asteroids provide you an infinite number of 3D space themed wallpaper for your new tab. Since every planet is rendered in 3D, the space wallpapers are interactive! You are able to move the camera freely to explore the planets in space. Each planet in space comes with its own unique name and stats such as temperature and habitability. 

Currently, there are three types of celestial space object in the Tabiverse: planets, stars, gas giants, and asteroids. Each space object might have a ring or moons. We are adding more space objects such as black holes and space anomalies very soon. You are also able to save and share your planet coordinates with your friends so that they can explore the same planets. More features such as an account system and multiplayer are also in the works.

Follow us on Twitter and join us on Discord to share feedback and get the latest news:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/tabiverse
Discord: https://discord.gg/MUgRGwE

Changelog
Version 0.0.0.16 - Feb 27th, 2020
- Made the gas giant's planet ring align with its planet's axis
- Made planet orbit camera's animation base on time instead of fps
- Animations no longer skip frames when tab is in the background

Version 0.0.0.15 - Feb 23rd, 2020
- Added a brand new type of celestial object: gas giants!
- Added multiverse system to preserve planets in the past versions
- Removed FPS setting. FPS is now as high as possible (synced to your monitor's refresh rate)
- Made "initial zoom animation" default to false

Version 0.0.0.14 - Feb 13th, 2020
- Added uninstall feedback form
- Performance optimizations

Version 0.0.0.13 - Feb 3rd, 2020
- Changed x, y, z coordinates to alpha, beta, gamma symbols in planet info page
- Indicated that the extension should work offline

Version 0.0.0.12 - Jan 27th, 2020
- Limited x, y, z coordinates to from -9999.99 to 9999.99
- Added planet booklet (top left) widget for checking planet history and bookmarks
- You are able to view the past 50 planets you have travelled
- You are able to bookmark up to 50 planets

Version 0.0.0.11 - Dec 30th, 2019
- Added random shuffle button to go to a random planet
- Added planet info scanner (currently shows name, habitability, temperature, type, and coordinates)
- Added seamless planet transitions
- Move camera further if planet has a ring, so the planet isn't too big
- Switches to a brand new font that is smooth and consistent across browsers
- Make ocean ridge planets more ridged
- Fixes seams between planet faces due to inconsistent normals
- Fixes some bugs regarding moons rendering

Version 0.0.0.10 - Dec 8th, 2019
- Added rings! Random ocean planets will have rings generated
- Added moons! Planets and asteroids have a chance to generate orbiting moons
- Added "Native Resolution" option to display HD graphics for retina displays. This setting can be computationally intense
- Changed default FPS to 60 

Version 0.0.0.9 - Nov 14th, 2019
- Fix a bug that prevents share link from being copied

Version 0.0.0.8 - Nov 8th, 2019
- Disable camera controls during animation
- Move all stars further away from the planet, so no stars are right beside the planet anymore
- Launch of https://tabiverse.com
- Added a share button on the top right corner. Your friends can view your planets without the extension through the link!

Version 0.0.0.7 - Oct 28th, 2019
- Shorten title to Tabiverse so the URL bar isn't obstructed as much
- Add a small damping effect to the camera rotation

Version 0.0.0.5 - Oct 16th, 2019
- Add initial zoom back as a setting (defaults to true) 

Version 0.0.0.4 - Oct. 16th, 2019
- Enabled camera rotation and zoom using mouse
- New celestial object: stars
- Planets should overall look more aesthetic
- Disabled zoom animation on page load to save loading time
- Improved planet transition animation
- More random planet types! (islands and ridged)

Version 0.0.0.2 - Oct. 2nd, 2019
- Initial Release
